meanings.definition: To make sweet or sweeter in taste.
meanings.sent1: She sweetened the tea with a spoonful of sugar.
meanings.sent2: The chef sweetened the sauce with a hint of honey.
meanings.sent3: The idea of adding chocolate chips to the salad was sweetened by the kids.
meanings.sent4: Her smile sweetened the room like a ray of sunshine.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the song sweetened the air with joy.

meanings.definition: To make more pleasant or agreeable.
meanings.sent1: He sweetened the deal by offering a discount.
meanings.sent3: The rainy day was sweetened by a surprise visit from a friend.
meanings.sent4: Her kind words sweetened the atmosphere of the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The success of the project sweetened their teamwork.

meanings.definition: Having sugar or a similar substance added to make it sweet.
meanings.sent1: The sweetened lemonade was refreshing on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the sweetened yogurt for breakfast.
meanings.sent3: The sweetened coffee brought a smile to his face.
meanings.sent4: The sweetened cake was a hit at the party.
meanings.sent5: The sweetened strawberries were a delicious dessert.
